channel.title: MR's Cyber Blog
channel.description: Recent content on MR's Cyber Blog

item.title: Passive Recon(OSINT) Resources
item.description: Passive Reconnaissance To gather intelligence on a target without actively interacting with the target. This is a list of tools which use passive reconnaissance techniques(E.g., OSINT, etc) to gather information on a target. ⚠️ Some resources may also contain additional tools that act outside passive reconnaissance techniques and may actively engage the target.
item.dc:creator: Matt Raupfer

item.title: DC-3 of DC Series(vulnhub)
item.description: I enjoyed DC-2’s Tom & Jerry theme! It showed us the concept of credential reuse and weak passwords, along with the wordpress and SUID exploits/abuses. Anyways, now onto DC-3.2 aka DC-3! Dropdown to see DC-3's quick overview DC-3 is another purposely built vulnerable lab with the intent of gaining experience in the world of penetration testing.
item.dc:creator: Matt Raupfer

item.title: DC-2 of DC Series(vulnhub)
item.description: With DC-1 out of the way, let’s move onto DC-2 of the DC Series! Dropdown to see DC-2's quick overview Much like DC-1, DC-2 is another purposely built vulnerable lab for the purpose of gaining experience in the world of penetration testing.
item.dc:creator: Matt Raupfer

item.title: DC-1 of DC Series(vulnhub)
item.description: Let’s root DC-1! Details can be found at https://www.five86.com/dc-1.html Open this to see the box's overview pulled from the above website. DC-1 is a purposely built vulnerable lab for the purpose of gaining experience in the world of penetration testing. It was designed to be a challenge for beginners, but just how easy it is will depend on your skills and knowledge, and your ability to learn.
item.dc:creator: Matt Raupfer

item.title: entry to networking
item.description: Basic Networking A network is two or more hosts connected together in order to exchange data. There’s two network types: WAN (Wide Area Network) - network that connects large geographical areas. LAN (Local Area Network) - network that is confined within a WAN network.
item.dc:creator: Matt Raupfer

item.title: osi model
item.description: OSI Layers(Open Systems Interconnection) and associated Protocol Data Unit(PDU) OSI Model is a 7 abstract layer table that’s responsible for explaining the flow of data within a network. Experienced individuals will often call out an issue by the culprit layer number.
item.dc:creator: Matt Raupfer

item.title: linux filesystem hierarchy
item.description: Linux uses a tree oriented hierarchy, meaning it starts at one point and branches outward. This starting point is the / (system root) directory. This particular hierarchy layout is based on the FHS (Filesystem Hierarchy Standard). FHS - (Filesystem Hierarchy Standard) Maintained by the Linux Foundation and last updated on June 3rd, 2015.
item.dc:creator: Matt Raupfer
